cons: I thought that changes made by management to the program in which I worked did not reflect the reality of work in Psychiatry in-patient units. They wanted evidence based practice but discounted twenty five years of practice based evidence.

review_title: Excellent company to work for but political
job_title: Project Manager in Edmonton, AB

cons: If you fall on the wrong side of upper management and leave the organization, don't ever expect another opportunity there again. The top is all connected.

job_title: Health Care Aide in Lethbridge, AB

review_title: OK experience, as long as you don't over think it
job_title: Health Care Aide in Edmonton, AB
pros: There were lots of shifts to pick up as a casual as people were always calling in sick.
cons: People constantly called in sick for a reason- tiring work where complex patients didn't receive appropriate PRNs and were aggressive as a result. Management liked to keep PRN usage extremely low so they could receive bonuses. They took pride in the fact that our facility had the lowest antipsychotic usage across the province... meanwhile the residents sun downed hard, were awake screaming all night, and would frequently punch, kick, smack, grab, swear, spit, and sometimes bite staff!

review_title: Great Recreation, Great Food, Clean Facility, Poor Management and Toxic Work Environment
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Lethbridge, AB
pros: Recreation is top notch, residents have more of a social life than I do. Food is high quality. Facility is clean.
cons: Expect to work short everyday. Expect infighting between employees. Expect to be easily reported by fellow employees. Expect to work with patients who are inappropriately admitted on to floors with extreme behavioral issues (violent, demented, abusive) and are to have your patients treated as paycheques to fill and rent rooms instead of human beings. Expect a toxic work environment and inexperienced management and top brass. Expect favoritism and cronyism. Expect cliques of workers who are not accepting or empathetic towards new employees. Expect bullying. Expect shortage of PPE and basic supplies. Expect never receiving praise Or positive attention for good work or going the extra mile. Expect to only receive negative attention by management when you have done something wrong. Expect shortened/Missed/no breaks at all.

review_title: Great place to work as a frontline nurse
job_title: Clinical Nurse Educator in Edmonton, AB
pros: Smaller community, more people-focused, not a "big machine".
cons: Limited advancement potential past front-line nursing: a lot of the exciting new initiatives are coming out of Alberta Health Services. I've reached a point where I know my nursing career in leadership and change management needs to be with AHS.

review_title: I enjoyed the work and made new and lasting friendships with colleagues however, the senior management was abusive.
job_title: Business Analyst in Edmonton, AB
pros: The front line caregivers were incredible and genuinely cared about their patients and residents. Most of my colleagues were great to work with. I enjoyed the work I was doing.
cons: Senior Management was not only unsupportive of their staff but often times verbally abusive, not the way to increase employee engagement which was their goal. The top three complaints were - staff didn't have the tools to effectively do their jobs, little or no training and favouritism. Incompetence promoted incompetence.

review_title: Exciting work with children ages between 14 month to 12 year old
job_title: Health Care Aide in Calgary, AB
pros: The children give me extraordinary satisfaction when they are learning something new. The feedback from them is instantly and direct which is rewarding to improve or to be proud about my job. I had the experience working with different group of ages.
cons: I was not using all my skills that I was  trained and in the health services I had not careers opportunity to improve in different aspect or rotate in the manage for other categories for seniors needs apart from that  I had no benefits at all.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Camrose, AB
pros: Good flexible hours, excellent benefits, friendly staff within all departments
cons: Certain department  managers sometimes being verbally abusive to staff.  Also bullying tactics by former HR (who no longer works there) by forcing staff to resign or quit just to save money within  Covenant Health.  Certain departments belittling staff.  Too much politics.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Edmonton, AB
pros:
Good income and ok benefits while it lasted. 
I wish I could put: opportunities for self-development 
Hours are good
cons:
Everything seemed like it was put in place for employees to be herded like sheep in their daily lives. Each person was given a self-worth sticker and if they ever tried to build themselves or become a better person, the guys on top will surely design their destruction 
No seriously

review_title: Employer talks the talk, but doesn't walk the walk
job_title: Administrative in Edmonton, AB
pros: Nice people, good hours, interesting work for the most part.
cons: Higher ups need to listen and act - follow up is key here!  There is no follow up on issues or resolutions.   Some underhanded and sneaky ways of getting rid of staff.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Edmonton, AB
pros:
Decent pay for an admin
If you are non-union, you get 6 flexible days off in addition to vacation time
Fun people to work with
Opportunity to move up or change departments

Don't always agree with all the policies but hard to change due to the Catholic faith with which some policies are created
Don't always get salary bumps if there's no money in the budget (standard for healthcare though)

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Edmonton, AB
pros: Work/life balance, great benefits, pension
cons: Wish I would've been told when I was hired that there has been a wage freeze on out of scope employees for over seven years!!! Little room for growth, reactionary management, little integration between department. Catholic values are archaic and impede growth of the organization
